body: is it added to the repo?

I added map here: https://github.com/seven1m/30-days-of-elixir/blob/master/05-dict-and-map.exs

I decided to leave record code because records are not completely going away (at least not yet) and some libraries still use them.

Sorry I haven't played with Elixir since version 0.13, but it appears that the list comprehension syntax changed before 1.0 was released. It appears that this:

```
some = lc n inlist sample, String.first(n) < "M", do: n <> " Morgan"
```

...should become this:

```
some = for n <- sample, String.first(n) < "M", do: n <> " Morgan"
```

See here: http://elixir-lang.org/getting_started/18.html

I haven't tried this, but if it works, would you make a Pull Request to fix it? I'd like to update this repo to work with Elixir 1.0.

Thanks!
@seven1m done, thanks, I'll try other exercises and fix if anything will be wrong :)
Thanks for assigning push permission. I'll try to fix the rest of them.
I've replaced the links throwing 404 with related ones under http://elixir-lang.org (I couldn't find exact match for some of them, as document structure has changed).
@eddwardo this same thing was done on day 24. I'd like to leave it there as it's a more advanced topic.
Looks great! With exception of the regex feedback, would merge.
Could you squash these commits? Other then this :+1:

Hi Piotrek,

I accidentally closed this pull request and it seems there's no way to reopened so I opened another pull request with the commits squashed. 

Tim actually granted me push permission for this repo so I took the liberty to accept the pull request.
